greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Binary dilution of n. GCD of exponents in binary expansion of n.
comment: All bits of n in positions not divisible by a(n) are zero. Hence n in binary contains blocks of a(n)-1 "diluting" 0's (for n>1). Also for n>1, a(2^n) = a(2^n + 1) = n. For i,j odd, a(ij) = GCD(a(i),a(j)).
link: Peter Kagey, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
program: (PARI) a(n) = if (n==0, 0, my(ve = select(x->x==1, Vecrev(binary(n)), 1)); gcd(vector(#ve, k, ve[k]-1))); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 12 2016
results.author: _Marc LeBrun_, Oct 11 2001
